us.pserver.revok

Class RemoteObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.pserver.revok.RemoteObject

  • public class RemoteObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a remote object for methods invocation.
    Version:
    1.1 - 201506
    Author:
    Juno Roesler - juno@pserver.com

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RemoteObject()
      Default constructor without arguments, uses a XmlSerializer for object serialization.
      RemoteObject(HttpConnector con)
      Constructor which receives a HttpConnector for network information.
      RemoteObject(HttpConnector con, ObjectSerializer serial)
      Constructor which receives HttpConnector and ObjectSerializer for objects serialization.

      • createRemoteObject

        public <T> T createRemoteObject(java.lang.String namespace,
                                java.lang.Class interfac)
        Create a Proxy instance of the remote object represented by the specified interface. Any method invocation in the returned proxy object, will be invoked remotly in the real object on server side.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the Proxy Object (same of the Class interface argument).
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace on the server where is stored the remote instance, or the [namespace].[objectname].
        interfac - Class of the Interface.
        Returns:
        The Proxy object created.

      • invoke

        public java.lang.Object invoke(RemoteMethod rmt)
                        throws MethodInvocationException
        Invoke the remote method.
        Parameters:
        rmt - Remote method information RemoteMethod.
        Returns:
        Remote method return value or null.
        Throws:
        MethodInvocationException - In case of error invoking the method.
